intro: Schmaltzia trilobata var. serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering schmaltzia, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets that are often hairy and lobed. The flowers, which appear in late summer to early fall, are small and white, contributing to its ornamental value in native gardens.
